title: A1398 820-3662-A Not powering on
message:
I have a 2013 macbook pro, I changed the left speaker, left it on overnight and battery died and is now not powering on.
All power rails are present, the only two that are slightly off are ppdcin_g3h and pdcin_g3h_isol which read 18.5v. Any ideas?

title: A1398 820-3662-A Not powering on
message:
Not powering on and all power rails are present, impossible at same time!

Please explain correctly.
Does the board stay on, but no video, nor USB activity present???

title: A1398 820-3662-A Not powering on
message:
Oh sorry, here is the read outs from just the board plugged into the magsafe. I just tested again and there are two rails no voltage. But when assembled, No power, no video, no usb activity 

PPBUS_G3H = 12.6

PPVIN_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS = 12.6

PPVIN_S5_HS_OTHER3V3_ISNS = 12.6

PPDCIN_G3H = 18.5

PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL = 18.5

PP3V42_G3H = 3.42

PPVRTC_G3H = 3.3

PP5V_S5 = 5

PP5V_S4 = 5

PP5V_S3 = 5

PP5V_S0 = 5

PP3V3_S5 = 3.3

PP3V3_S4 = 3.3

PP3V3_SUS = 3.3

PP3V3_S3 = 3.3

PP3V3_S0 = 3.3

PP3V3_S3RS0_CAMERA = 3.3

PP1V35_S3 = 1.35

PP1V35_S3_MEM = 1.35

PP1V35_S3RS0_CPUDDR = 1.35

PP1V35_S3RS0_FET = 1.35

PP1V5_S0 = 1.5

PPVCC_S0_CPU = 1.8

*PPBUS_SW_BKL = 0

PP3V3_TBTLC = 3.3

*PP15V_TBT = 0

title: A1398 820-3662-A Not powering on
message:
Test the board alone on the desk; disconnect any other cable, keep only charger.
Use a macOS pendrive (with Link LED) attached to onboard USB port.
If LED flashes, there is USB activity for sure.

Do not waste time measuring same power rail in different points.
You will get the same voltage; unless trace is broken.

Do not expect a Thunderbolt related voltage, until a device is connected.
Do not search backlight voltages/signals for a board without internal image, nor USB activity.

Battery is charging?
Do you have original 60/85W Magsafe 2 charger?

Just in case, try known good working BIOS.

title: A1398 820-3662-A Not powering on
message:
No USB Activity, just flashed new confirmed BIOS and still nothing.
Is battery necessary to power on laptop? I tested battery with mulitmeter and it seems ok, how to test if battery is charging if laptop has no power?
Using Original 85W magsafe 2 
Any ideas?

title: A1398 820-3662-A Not powering on
message:
"how to test if battery is charging if laptop has no power?"
Monitor PPBUS_G3H with charger and battery, both connected.

title: A1398 820-3662-A Not powering on
message: Using multimeter voltage DC setting?

title: A1398 820-3662-A Not powering on
message:
Of course...

PPBUS_G3H should slightly increase, according with battery level.

title: A1398 820-3662-A Not powering on
message: ok just making sure as it wasn't slightly increasing, I watched it for about 4mins and nothing but would this be why it wont power on? Is the battery necessary for it power on?

title: A1398 820-3662-A Not powering on
message:
These boards are from worst Apple series.
In theory, should start without battery; with proper charger, original 60/85W Magsafe 2.
Post exact PPBUS_G3H voltage with charger; w/ and w/o battery connected.

title: A1398 820-3662-A Not powering on
message: Yeah  this model is total crap, I hate these models. My exact Voltage is 12.89 w/ and w/o battery connected

title: A1398 820-3662-A Not powering on
message:
Looks like battery is not recognized.
The value is a bit high, I recommend you to change your multimeter battery.

title: A1398 820-3662-A Not powering on
message: OK changed batteries on multimeter and now its 12.58 w/ and w/o battery connected

title: A1398 820-3662-A Not powering on
message:
In fact, looking at posted volatges, board turned on; but not working.
May be damaged CPU because of FDMF6808 chips.

title: A1398 820-3662-A Not powering on
message:
Im sorry maybe I was testing it wrong. If I plug the magsagfe direct to the board w/o battery I get 12.58-12.6
If I unplug magsafe, attach battery then plug magsafe back in I get 12.89-12.90. Does that matter?

title: A1398 820-3662-A Not powering on
message: I pulled a battery out an A1417 battery and connected to to board with magsafe and monitored  PPBUS_G3H voltage with multimeter and it slowly climbs, watched it climb from 12.10-12.70

title: A1398 820-3662-A Not powering on
message:
That is sign of charging battery.
Still not working then?
Tested USB activity on USB onboard port?

title: A1398 820-3662-A Not powering on
message: Yeah still not powering on. Tested USB and still no LED light :(

title: A1398 820-3662-A Not powering on
message: Probably CPU issue...
